author: Nina Trentmann
title: CFO Moves: Fred’s, Statoil, Aegion
text:
0 COMMENTS CFOs on the move. Photo: The Wall Street Journal
Fred’s Inc. , a Memphis, Tenn.-based operator of general merchandise stores and pharmacies, said Chief Financial Officer Joseph Anto will serve as interim chief executive officer, effective April 24, 2018. His appointment follows the resignation of the company’s previous CEO Michael K. Bloom, effective April 24, 2018. Mr. Anto has served as executive vice president, CFO and secretary since Feb. 2018. Prior to that, he worked as a consultant for Fred’s.
Aegion Corp. , a Chesterfield, Mo. infrastructure company, disclosed compensation details for David F. Morris who was named CFO in addition to his previous position as executive vice president, effective April 17, 2018. His annual base salary rises from $412,050 to $440,000 and his annual incentive bonus target will increase from 60% to 70% of his annual base salary. The company also approved a grant to Mr. Morris of restricted stock units having an aggregate nominal value of approximately $500,000 with a grant date of April 23, 2018. The restricted stock units will cliff vest on April 23, 2023, according to a filing.
Statoil ASA , the Norwegian energy company, appointed Lars Christian Bacher CFO. He succeeds the company’s current CFO Hans Jakob Hegge who will become U.S. country manager. Mr. Bacher previously served as executive vice president development and production international. He will take up his new role in August 2018, Statoil said in a release. Compensation details were not immediately available.
